meanings.definition: To inform against; denounce or accuse.
meanings.sent1: She delates her friend to the teacher for cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The witness decided to delates the suspect to the police.
meanings.sent3: The little boy thought it would be funny to delates his sister for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower bravely delates the corrupt practices of the company.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm delates the presence of danger in the building.

meanings.definition: To carry or take away; remove.
meanings.sent1: The movers delates the heavy furniture from the old house to the new one.
meanings.sent2: Please delates the trash from the kitchen before it starts to smell.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to delates the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The wind can delates the fallen leaves from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner delates the dust particles from the carpet effectively.
